MANDATORY_READS: context/research-summary.md - USE EXACT LANGUAGE FROM VOICE & TONE

STRATEGY.tone: Fashion Insider - Cognitive Disruption, NOT tech specs

requirements.images: TESTIMONIAL images only (social proof) - NOT product shots

OBJECTION_MAPPING.CRITICAL: Each Micro Feature SUBTLY addresses an objection type

feature_1.objection: VEHICLE - Why other products' mechanisms fail
feature_1.example_truth: That $50 jacket? Its zipper will catch and stick within a month.
feature_1.example_benefit: Ours uses YKK hardware that glides for years.

feature_2.objection: INTERNAL - Why it'll work for HER body
feature_2.example_truth: Length isn't modesty; cut is modesty.
feature_2.example_benefit: Our curved rise covers you without looking boxy.

feature_3.example_truth: Decorative pockets are fashion's laziest trick.
feature_3.example_benefit: Real pockets that actually fit your phone.

feature_4.objection: VEHICLE - Another mechanism that usually fails
feature_4.example_truth: Tight sleeves aren't 'fitted' - they're poorly drafted.
feature_4.example_benefit: Our sleeve allows full movement without bulk.

DISRUPTIVE_HEADLINE.rule: Name the problem like an insider would

examples: Visible zippers aren't 'edgy' - they're lazy design.
Length isn't modesty; cut is modesty.
Decorative pockets are fashion's laziest trick.
THE_TRUTH.rule: Challenge a common belief with insider knowledge

examples: Our hidden zipper keeps the line clean.
Our curved rise covers you without looking boxy.
Real pockets that actually fit your phone.
THE_BENEFIT.rule: Show how THIS piece solves it - focus on FEELING

images.CRITICAL: MUST be testimonial/social proof images - NOT product shots
images.WHY: Social proof images show REAL women wearing it, building trust while explaining specs

tone_guidance.write_like: A fashion insider revealing industry secrets
tone_guidance.MUST_USE: Exact language patterns from research-summary.md Voice & Tone

anti_laziness_check: Does each headline NAME a problem like an insider would?
Does each Truth challenge a common belief?
Does each Benefit focus on how she'll FEEL?
Did I map each feature to its objection type (Vehicle/Internal/External)?
Am I using TESTIMONIAL images, not product shots?
Is the copy ~40 words per card (not too long)?
Did I use language from the research Voice & Tone section?
Would a fashion-savvy woman read this and think 'finally, someone who gets it'?
